attributes.documentation:
@dev Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
specific functions.
 * This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
`onlyOwner`, which can be aplied to your functions to restrict their use to
the owner.
attributes.name: Ownable

attributes.documentation: @dev Initializes the contract setting the deployer as the initial owner.
@dev Returns the address of the current owner.
attributes.name: owner

attributes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
attributes.name: onlyOwner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

attributes.type: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"
attributes.value: Ownable: caller is not the owner

attributes.documentation: @dev Returns true if the caller is the current owner.
attributes.name: isOwner

attributes.documentation:
@dev Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call
`onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.
     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,
thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
attributes.name: renounceOwnership

attributes.documentation:
@dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
Can only be called by the current owner.
attributes.name: transferOwnership

attributes.documentation: @dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
attributes.name: _transferOwnership

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: new owner is the zero address"

attributes.type: literal_string "Ownable: new owner is the zero address"
attributes.value: Ownable: new owner is the zero address

attributes.documentation:
@dev Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP. Does not include
the optional functions; to access them see `ERC20Detailed`.
attributes.name: IERC20

attributes.documentation: @dev Returns the amount of tokens in existence.
attributes.name: totalSupply

attributes.documentation: @dev Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.
attributes.name: balanceOf
transfer

attributes.documentation:
@dev Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be
allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through `transferFrom`. This is
zero by default.
     * This value changes when `approve` or `transferFrom` are called.
attributes.name: allowance

attributes.documentation:
@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
     * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
     * > Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
desired value afterwards:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
     * Emits an `Approval` event.
attributes.name: approve

attributes.documentation:
@dev Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the
allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
allowance.
     * Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
     * Emits a `Transfer` event.
attributes.name: transferFrom
Transfer

attributes.documentation:
@dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
a call to `approve`. `value` is the new allowance.
attributes.name: Approval

attributes.documentation: @title Registry for managing polymath feature switches
attributes.name: FeatureRegistry
getFeatureStatus
setFeatureStatus

attributes.documentation: @title Utility contract to allow owner to retreive any ERC20 sent to the contract
attributes.name: ReclaimTokens

attributes.documentation:
@notice Reclaim all ERC20Basic compatible tokens
@param _tokenContract The address of the token contract
attributes.name: reclaimERC20

attributes.documentation: @title Interface for managing polymath feature switches
attributes.name: IFeatureRegistry
setFeatureStatus
getFeatureStatus
